description.narrative: "This project is implemented by Oxfam in Vietnam under the MARP programme, and funded by the Swiss Agency for Development and Cooperation (SDC) and Oxfam Hong Kong. The overall goal of the project is to reduce poverty, increase livelihood diversificationand enhance resilience of ethnic minorities and women in the poorest and marginalized up-land areas of Vietnam, through pro-poor value chain development of rattan and Lung bamboo. Total approved budget of US$1,342,394 (SDC funded US$831,732 and OHK and others contribute US$510,662).ApproachThe project works to achieve three outcomes:1. Increased annual income for ethnic minorities and poor women from sustainable production and marketing of rattan and Lung raw material.2. Increased annual income for ethnicminorities and poor women through value addition of rattan and Lung products, and3. Promoted enabling environment to support pro-poor rattan and Lung value chain development from local to regional level.Target GroupsThe project targets poor upland ethnicminorities and women as actors along rattan and bamboo value chain including growers, producers, collectors, pre-processors and traders. The project directly targets four districts in Nghe An province: Que Phong, Quy Chau, Tuong Duong and Con Cuong.Expected ResultsThe project aims for a 30-40% increase in the annual income of about 2,500 to 3,000 poor upland ethnic minorities and women through increasing their access to the rattan and bamboo value chain in Nghe An province. Direct benefits from this project will include increased and sustainable collective commercial production, improved processing and design of manufactured goods, stronger bargaining power and long-term contractual arrangements with traders and manufacturers, in-depth market analysis and ensured capacity to respond to its fluctuations (particularly in view of the envisaged increase of production from seedlings up to final handicraft products). This project will create permanent employment for 520 persons: 80 in nursery establishment (full-time), 40 in rattan processing (50% time), 200 in Lung processing (60% time), and 200 in handicraft production (75% time). Similarly, temporary employment is expected to be created for 2,200 persons: 1,200 in rattan plantation, intercropping and rattanharvesting, 500 in Lung harvesting, and 500 through forest enrichment. By the end of the project term, beneficiaries will have generated additional income of about 1 million USD, with 75% earned by women. Given the importance and potential of the sector,from local to national and regional level, experiences generated by the project have a high potential for up-scaling and replication in other sectors. "

participating-org.narrative: Nghe An Department of Foreign Affai

Nghe An Department of Foreign Affairs (DOFA) was established in 2012, Decision No.60/2012/QD-UBND of the People's Committee of NgheAn Province. DOFA has been assigned by the Nghe An#s People Committee (the highest level) to coordinate, monitor and manage all projects of all NGOs (INGO, local NGO) in the province. All operations of any NGOs must go through DOFA and get their approval before getting to other departments In the project proposal to SDC, a provincial project steering committee should be setup to provide steering management and coordinate all activities at the province and district level. After discussion with provincial partners and government departments, a Coordination Board was set up in July 2013, which includes members of all related departments (Department of Rural Development, Department of Industry and Trade, Department of Planning and Investment), SDC, and OHK. After various consultation meetings, the DOFA, with their mandates and functions above-mentioned, was elected by all boardmembers to be the lead of the board. DOFA will play an important role in networking with various government departments to facilitate a favorable policy environment for the development of rattan/bamboo sector in the province. This particularly focuses ondeveloping a master plan/strategy for rattan/bamboo sector in 4 project district and in the whole province in general, to advocate for more supportive policies for enterprises andfarmers and other stakeholders in rattan/bamboo sector in Nghe An. DOFA isan active member at the province level which will help Oxfam to connect with high profile policy makers at province and central government to influence for changes in agricultural policies.
